questions.questionText: Which note is located on the second line of the treble clef?
questions.hint: The treble clef line notes spell EGBDF.
questions.explanation: The second line of the treble clef represents the note G.

questions.questionText: Which of these notes is placed on the first space of the treble clef?
questions.hint: The spaces in the treble clef spell FACE.
questions.explanation: The first space of the treble clef contains the note F.

questions.questionText: What is the name of this note located on the first ledger line above the staff?
questions.hint: This note is above the treble clef.
questions.explanation: The first ledger line above the treble staff represents the note A.

questions.questionText: What note is on the first ledger line below the treble clef?
questions.hint: This is also known as middle C.
questions.explanation: Middle C is located on the first ledger line below the treble clef.

questions.questionText: Which of these symbols represents a whole rest?
questions.hint: A whole rest looks like an upside-down hat.
questions.explanation: A whole rest hangs from the fourth line of the staff and represents four beats of silence.

questions.questionText: Listen to the audio and identify the note.
questions.hint: This note is on the first line of the treble clef.
questions.explanation: The note played is E, which is located on the first line of the treble clef.

questions.questionText: Which note is on the fourth space of the treble clef?
questions.hint: The spaces in the treble clef spell FACE.
questions.explanation: The fourth space in the treble clef is E.

questions.questionText: Which note is played when all the white keys are pressed in order starting from C?
questions.hint: This scale contains no sharps or flats.
questions.explanation: The C major scale consists of the notes C, D, E, F, G, A, and B.

questions.questionText: How many beats does a quarter rest last?
questions.hint: A quarter rest lasts for the same time as a quarter note.
questions.explanation: A quarter rest lasts for one beat in common time (4/4).

questions.questionText: Which of these is a sharp note?
questions.hint: A sharp note is indicated with a # symbol.
questions.explanation: C# is a sharp note that is one semitone higher than C.
